# Diodes

A  __diode __ is a  __semiconductor __ device that allows electrical current to flow in one direction only\.

The diode has two terminals\, called the  __anode __ and the  __cathode__ \.

A ring mark on the diode case identifies the terminal corresponding to the cathode\.

The other terminal corresponds to the anode\.

The diode consists of two layers of semiconducting material:

![](l3.1-diode-circuits-analysis-img/l31-diode-circuits-analysis_1.png)

![](l3.1-diode-circuits-analysis-img/l31-diode-circuits-analysis_2.png)



      * A  <span style="color:#0000ff"> __P\-type __ </span> semiconductor layer containing positive charge carriers \(holes\)\.  <span style="color:#339933">The P\-type layer corresponds to the anode \(A\) terminal of the</span>  <span style="color:#339933"> </span>  <span style="color:#339933">diode\.</span>
      * An  <span style="color:#0000ff"> __N\-type__ </span>  <span style="color:#000080"> __ __ </span> semiconductor layer containing negative charge carriers \(electrons\)\.  <span style="color:#339933">The N\-type layer corresponds to the cathode \(K\) terminal of the</span>  <span style="color:#339933"> </span>  <span style="color:#339933">diode</span>  <span style="color:#339933">\.</span>


![](l3.1-diode-circuits-analysis-img/l31-diode-circuits-analysis_3.png)

::: {.notes}

Explain the process as a self regulated system

:::

<span style="color:#c00000"> __Recall: Operation__ </span>

When no voltage is present across the diode terminals\, the diode is in the “off” \(blocked\) state\. No current flows through the diode\, and the diode acts like an  <span style="color:#002060"> __open switch__ </span> \.

<span style="color:#339933">When </span>  <span style="color:#339933">voltage at the anode is lower than the voltage at the cathode</span> \, the diode is said to be  <span style="color:#000080"> __reverse biased\. __ </span> Diode still acts as an open switch and no current flows through the diode\.

<span style="color:#339933">When the voltage at the anode is higher than the voltage at the cathode</span> \, diode is said to be  <span style="color:#000080"> __forward biased\. __ </span> Diode acts as a closed switch\, allowing the current to flow from the anode to the cathode\.

![](l3.1-diode-circuits-analysis-img/l31-diode-circuits-analysis_4.png)

![](l3.1-diode-circuits-analysis-img/l31-diode-circuits-analysis_5.png)

# Diodes Circuits Analysis

<span style="color:#c00000"> __Load__ </span>  <span style="color:#0066ff"> </span>  <span style="color:#c00000"> __Line__ </span>  <span style="color:#c00000"> __  __ </span>  <span style="color:#c00000"> __Analysis:__ </span>

The operating point of a diode can be determined by a  <span style="color:#0000ff">load\-line analysis </span> of the voltage\-current characteristic\.

![](l3.1-diode-circuits-analysis-img/l31-diode-circuits-analysis_8.jpg)

![](l3.1-diode-circuits-analysis-img/l31-diode-circuits-analysis_9.png)

Determine Point A\, where no current is flowing through the diode\. \(diode open\)

Determine Point B\, where no voltage drop across the diode\. \(diode closed\)

Construct  <span style="color:#0000ff">Load Line </span> by connecting the two points\.

<span style="color:#0000ff">Operating point \(Q\-point\)</span>  is given by the intersection of the load line and the diode characteristic\.

![](l3.1-diode-circuits-analysis-img/l31-diode-circuits-analysis_10.jpg)

<span style="color:#336600">L</span>  <span style="color:#336600">oad line is determined </span>  <span style="color:#336600">by </span>  <span style="color:#336600">the  </span>  <span style="color:#336600">applied </span>  <span style="color:#336600">network\, </span>  <span style="color:#336600">whereas </span>  <span style="color:#336600">the </span>  <span style="color:#336600">diode </span>  <span style="color:#336600">characteristics  are </span>  <span style="color:#336600">defined by </span>  <span style="color:#336600">the </span>  <span style="color:#336600">selected</span>  <span style="color:#336600"> </span>  <span style="color:#336600">device\.</span>

<span style="color:#0000ff">Q\- point </span>  <span style="color:#336600">is the </span>  <span style="color:#202124">quiescent</span>  <span style="color:#336600"> operating point\.</span>

::: {.notes}
